metadata.creator: Sergio Contreras
metadata.description: The episode begins with interviews with members of the Canadian Hispanic Congress. In their interviews they talk about different opportunities for Hispanic immigrants to help integrate into Canadian life without losing their heritage and while connecting with other Hispanics. Next there is a Chilean documentary called Javiera de Chile which is the story of the daughter of JosÃ© Manuel Parada; a member of the communist party who was assasinated on March 30, 1985. The episode ends with Mexican dances performed by an Andino Group at Grant MacEwan University.
metadata.title: Programa Nosotros. 5th Latin American Festival
metadata.subject: Canadian Hispanic Congress; El congreso hispano canadiense; Chilean documentary; documental chileano; military regimen; rÃ©gimen militar; social conflicts; conflictos sociales; Mexican dances; bailandos mexicanos
